title-group.article-title: Covers of the Integers with Odd Moduli and Their Applications to the Forms $x^m - 2^n $ And $x^2 - F_{3n} /2$

abstract.p: In this paper we construct a cover $\{ a_s (\bmod n_s )\} _{s = 1}^k $ of Z with odd moduli such that there are distinct primes $P_1 ,....,P_k $ dividing $2^{n_1 } - 1,....,2^{n_k } - 1$ respectively. Using this cover we show that for any positive integer m divisible by none of 3, 5, 7, 11, 13 there exists an infinite arithmetic progression of positive odd integers the mth powers of whose terms are never of the form $2^n \pm p^a $ with a,n ∈{0,1,2...}and p a prime. We also construct another cover of ${\Bbb Z}$ with odd moduli and use it to prove that $2^n \pm p^a $ has at least two distinct prime factors whenever n ∈ {0,1,2,...} and x ≡ a (mod M), where $\{ F_i \} _{i \ge 0} $ is the Fibonacci sequence, and a and M are suitable positive integers having 80 decimal digits.
